definitions: move or go upward through space or along a surface
rise to a higher position rank or level in a hierarchy
climb up a steep slope mountain or similar physical structure
examples: The hot air balloon ascended slowly into the morning sky
Smoke from the campfire ascended through the tall pine trees
She ascended to the position of CEO after years of dedication
The young officer ascended through the military ranks remarkably quickly
The climbers ascended the mountain face despite dangerous weather conditions
We ascended the ancient stone staircase to reach the temple

definitions: discover or determine something with certainty through investigation or examination
confirm the truth or accuracy of information through careful verification
examples: The detective worked tirelessly to ascertain the suspect's whereabouts that night
Scientists conducted experiments to ascertain the cause of the phenomenon
Please ascertain that all safety protocols have been properly followed
The audit team will ascertain whether the financial records are accurate

definitions: regard something as being caused by or belonging to a particular source
assign a particular quality or characteristic to someone or something
examples: Historians ascribe the monument's construction to the ancient Egyptian dynasty
Many people ascribe their success to hard work and determination
Critics often ascribe genius to artists who challenge conventional thinking
The teacher ascribed excellent analytical skills to her brightest students

definitions: burn something completely until it becomes powdery residue or ash
cover or sprinkle something with ash or ash-like substance
examples: The volcanic eruption ashed entire villages within a fifty-mile radius
The intense fire ashed the documents beyond any possible recovery
The gardener ashed the soil to improve its alkalinity levels
Farmers traditionally ashed their fields after the harvest season ended

definitions: say something to obtain an answer or information from someone
request someone to do or give something politely
invite someone to attend an event or go somewhere
expect or require something of someone as a price or condition
examples: She asked him several questions about his travel experiences abroad
The children constantly ask why the sky appears blue during daytime
Could you ask your manager for permission to leave early today
The customer asked the waiter to bring extra napkins please
They asked us to their wedding celebration next month in June
My parents asked the new neighbors over for dinner last night
The job asks too much of employees without adequate compensation benefits
This recipe asks for ingredients that are difficult to find locally

definitions: cover or pave a surface with asphalt material for construction
apply a new layer of asphalt to repair or improve road surfaces
examples: The city will asphalt the damaged street sections next Monday morning
Workers asphalted the entire parking lot in just two days
The highway department asphalts major roads every five to seven years
They need to asphalt this pothole-filled avenue before winter arrives

definitions: have a strong desire or ambition to achieve something significant
direct one's hopes or ambitions toward achieving a particular goal
examples: Many young athletes aspire to compete in the Olympic Games someday
She has always aspired to become a renowned medical researcher
The company aspires to carbon neutrality within the next decade
He aspires to excellence in everything he undertakes professionally

definitions: murder an important person especially for political or religious reasons deliberately
kill a public figure or leader as part of a planned attack
examples: Conspirators attempted to assassinate the president during the state ceremony yesterday
The historical novel depicted how rebels planned to assassinate the tyrant
Political extremists threatened to assassinate government officials who supported the legislation
Security forces prevented an attempt to assassinate the visiting foreign minister

definitions: make a physical attack on someone with intent to cause harm
attack someone with harsh criticism or verbal abuse aggressively
make a concerted military attack on a fortified position
examples: The attacker assaulted the victim in the parking garage after midnight
Three men assaulted the security guard during the robbery attempt
The critic verbally assaulted the director's latest film mercilessly
Opposition politicians assaulted the government's new policy proposals
The troops assaulted the enemy fortress at dawn breaking through defenses
Special forces assaulted the compound where hostages were being held

definitions: test a metal or ore to determine its ingredients and quality
analyze or examine something to determine its components or nature
attempt or try to accomplish something particularly something challenging
examples: The metallurgist will assay the gold ore to determine its purity
Mining companies regularly assay rock samples from potential drilling sites
Scientists assay blood samples to detect the presence of specific antibodies
The laboratory assays tissue specimens for signs of abnormal cell growth
The young knight will assay to prove his valor in battle
She decided to assay the difficult climb despite weather warnings

definitions: gather people or things together in one place for a purpose
fit together the separate parts of something to create a whole
come together as a group of people for a common purpose
examples: The teacher assembled all students in the auditorium for announcements
Workers assembled the materials needed for the construction project
She carefully assembled the furniture according to the instruction manual
The factory assembles thousands of electronic devices every single day
Protesters assembled peacefully in the town square Saturday afternoon
The committee members assembled to discuss the urgent budget crisis

definitions: agree to a proposal or request after careful consideration
express approval or agreement especially by nodding or similar gesture
examples: The board members assented to the merger after lengthy deliberations yesterday
Parliament must assent to any changes in constitutional law
She silently assented when asked if she understood the terms
The judge assented with a brief nod to the lawyer's request

definitions: state a fact or belief confidently and forcefully without proof
defend or enforce one's rights or position against opposition
make one's presence or influence felt strongly in a situation
examples: The lawyer asserted that her client was innocent of all charges
Scientists assert that climate change poses serious risks to humanity
Workers must assert their rights to fair wages and safe conditions
She learned to assert herself in meetings with senior management
The team finally asserted their dominance in the second half
The company asserted its market leadership through innovative product launches

definitions: evaluate or estimate the nature quality or ability of something
calculate or estimate the value or amount for taxation purposes
make a judgment about a situation after careful consideration
examples: Teachers regularly assess student progress through tests and assignments
The committee will assess all applications based on specific criteria
The city assessor will assess your property value for tax purposes
Insurance adjusters assess damage claims after natural disasters occur
Military strategists assess the tactical situation before planning operations
Doctors assess patients' symptoms to determine appropriate treatment plans

definitions: allocate a task duty or responsibility to a particular person
appoint someone to a particular job position or role officially
transfer legal rights or property to another person formally
examples: The teacher assigned homework problems from chapters three through five
The manager assigns daily tasks to team members every morning
The military assigned him to serve at the overseas base
They assigned a new detective to investigate the cold case
The inventor assigned all patent rights to the technology company
She assigned her lease to another tenant before moving abroad

definitions: take in and understand information or ideas fully and thoroughly
become absorbed and integrated into a society or culture gradually
absorb and digest food or nutrients into the body tissues
examples: Students need time to assimilate complex mathematical concepts properly
She quickly assimilated the new procedures and began working independently
Immigrants often struggle to assimilate into their new country's culture
The refugees gradually assimilated into the local community over time
The body assimilates proteins more slowly than simple carbohydrates
Plants assimilate carbon dioxide during the photosynthesis process

definitions: help someone by doing part of their work or task
contribute to achieving something or making something easier
examples: The nurse assists the doctor during surgical procedures every day
Volunteers assist elderly residents with their grocery shopping needs
Good lighting assists in reducing eye strain while reading
Modern technology assists scientists in making breakthrough discoveries

definitions: connect someone or something with something else in your mind
work together as partners or colleagues in business or activity
spend time with someone or be frequently in their company
examples: Most people associate owls with wisdom and nocturnal hunting behavior
The detective associates these clues with the previous robbery case
The two companies will associate to develop new pharmaceutical products
She associates with leading researchers in her scientific field
He prefers to associate with intellectuals and creative artists
Parents worry about whom their teenagers associate with after school

definitions: make an unpleasant feeling or pain less intense through comfort
satisfy or appease a need desire or appetite partially
examples: The counselor tried to assuage the parents' fears about their child
Nothing could assuage his guilt over the terrible accident
The small meal barely assuaged their hunger after the long journey
The compromise assuaged both parties' concerns about the contract terms

definitions: suppose something to be true without proof as a starting point
take on or begin to have power responsibility or a position
begin to have or display a particular quality or appearance
pretend to have a different identity or character falsely
examples: Scientists assume that dark matter exists based on gravitational effects
Never assume someone agrees just because they remain silent
The vice president will assume leadership duties during the transition
She assumed full responsibility for the project's unexpected failure
His face assumed a serious expression during the solemn ceremony
The sky assumed darker shades as the storm approached rapidly
The spy assumed a false identity to infiltrate the organization
He assumed an air of confidence despite feeling nervous inside

definitions: tell someone something positively to remove doubts or anxiety
make something certain to happen or be achieved reliably
secure insurance coverage especially on someone's life formally
examples: The doctor assured us that the surgery would be completely safe
I can assure you that all arrangements have been properly made
Regular maintenance assures the smooth operation of complex machinery
These measures will assure the project's success despite challenges
They assured their lives for one million dollars each
The company assured its assets against natural disaster damage

definitions: mark text with an asterisk symbol to indicate a footnote
draw special attention to something as particularly important or notable
examples: Please asterisk the items that require immediate attention today
The editor asterisked several passages that needed fact checking
The coach asterisked the plays that worked best during practice
Scientists asterisk significant findings in their research data tables

definitions: make amends or reparation for wrongdoing or sin through action
compensate morally for bad actions through good deeds or suffering
examples: He tried to atone for his mistakes by working overtime unpaid
The community service helps offenders atone for their crimes
She spent years trying to atone for abandoning her family
Many religions teach that sacrifice can atone for sins

definitions: waste away or decrease in size especially of body tissue or organs
gradually decline in effectiveness or vigor due to underuse or neglect
examples: Muscles atrophy rapidly when immobilized in a cast for weeks
The patient's leg muscles atrophied during the long hospital stay
Skills atrophy without regular practice and continuous learning
Their relationship atrophied after years of living in different countries

definitions: fasten join or connect one thing to another physically or mechanically
associate or connect something with something else in thought or principle
assign someone temporarily to a different unit or organization officially
develop strong feelings of affection or loyalty toward someone
examples: Please attach the document to your email before sending it
Workers attached solar panels to the roof using special brackets
Scientists attach great importance to peer review in research
People often attach memories to specific songs or scents
The military attached him to the intelligence unit for training
They attached a liaison officer to coordinate between departments
Children quickly attach to caring and consistent caregivers
She became attached to the stray cat she'd been feeding

definitions: take aggressive action against a person or place using violence
criticize or oppose someone or something fiercely and publicly
begin to deal with something with determination and vigor
act harmfully on something causing damage or disease progressively
examples: The army attacked the enemy fortress at dawn with full force
A wild animal attacked the hikers on the mountain trail
Opposition leaders attacked the government's new economic policy harshly
Critics attacked the film for its historical inaccuracies
She attacked the problem with remarkable energy and creativity
The team attacked their training regime with renewed enthusiasm
Rust slowly attacks metal surfaces exposed to moisture
The virus attacks the respiratory system causing severe complications

definitions: succeed in achieving something after effort especially a goal or ambition
reach or arrive at a particular level age or condition
examples: She finally attained her dream of becoming a published author
The company attained record profits despite economic challenges
The spacecraft attained a velocity of twenty thousand miles per hour
He attained the age of ninety while maintaining excellent health

definitions: make an effort to accomplish or complete something difficult or challenging
try to climb or reach the summit of a mountain or peak
examples: She will attempt to break the world record next month
The students attempted to solve the complex equation together
Three climbers will attempt Everest via the north face route
No one has successfully attempted this dangerous peak in winter

definitions: be present at an event place or meeting as a participant
pay attention to what someone is saying or to something happening
look after someone who is ill or provide them with help
accompany or escort someone especially in a formal capacity
examples: Over five hundred delegates will attend the international conference tomorrow
She attends yoga classes three times every week regularly
Please attend carefully to these important safety instructions
The students attended to every word the professor spoke
Nurses attend patients throughout their recovery from surgery
A physician attended the injured athlete immediately after the accident
Several bodyguards attended the celebrity during the public appearance
Ladies-in-waiting attended the queen at all formal ceremonies

definitions: provide or serve as clear evidence or proof of something
formally certify or declare something to be true or genuine
examples: Historical documents attest to the city's importance in ancient times
Her achievements attest to years of dedicated training and practice
The notary will attest that all signatures on the contract are genuine
I can attest to his character having known him for twenty years

definitions: dress in clothes of a specified kind especially formal clothing
provide with clothes or put clothes on another person
examples: Guests should attire themselves appropriately for the formal dinner
The bride attired herself in an elegant white gown
Servants attired the nobleman in his ceremonial robes
The costume designer attired all actors in period-appropriate clothing

definitions: cause someone to have interest in or liking for something
evoke interest admiration or attention from people generally
draw something closer through physical force such as magnetism
examples: The museum's new exhibit attracts thousands of visitors each month
Bright colors attract young children's attention more than pastels
The festival attracts tourists from all over the world annually
Her charismatic personality attracts people wherever she goes
Magnets attract iron filings and other ferromagnetic materials
Opposite electrical charges attract each other with measurable force

definitions: regard something as being caused by someone or something specifically
assign a quality or feature as characteristic or possession of someone
examples: Historians attribute the empire's fall to economic and military factors
Scientists attribute climate change primarily to human industrial activities
Critics attribute exceptional talent to the young pianist's performances
Ancient Greeks attributed various powers to their numerous gods

definitions: sell goods or property at a public sale to highest bidder
offer something for sale through a competitive bidding process
examples: The estate will auction the antique furniture collection next Saturday
They auctioned their rare book collection to pay medical bills
The government auctions seized property through online platforms regularly
The charity will auction donated items at their annual fundraiser

definitions: conduct an auction by accepting bids and declaring goods sold
act as a professional seller at public auctions regularly
examples: She will auctioneer at the charity event this weekend professionally
He has auctioneered estate sales for over twenty years
The company auctioneers fine art throughout major European cities
They auctioneer livestock at the county fair every summer

definitions: conduct an official examination and verification of financial accounts and records
attend a course or class as a listener without receiving academic credit
conduct a systematic review or assessment of something for evaluation
examples: The firm will audit our company's financial statements next quarter
Government inspectors audit tax returns for accuracy and compliance
She decided to audit the philosophy course out of personal interest
Many retirees audit university classes to continue learning
The team will audit workplace safety procedures every six months
Consultants audit our cybersecurity systems for potential vulnerabilities

definitions: perform a practical demonstration of skill for a role or position
assess or test someone's suitability for a role through performance
examples: She will audition for the lead role tomorrow morning downtown
Hundreds of dancers audition for the prestigious ballet company annually
The director will audition fifty actors for the new production
They audition musicians every semester for the symphony orchestra

definitions: make something greater by adding to it in size or quantity
supplement or enhance something by adding extra elements or resources
examples: The company will augment its workforce with temporary seasonal employees
They augmented their income by taking freelance projects evenings
Virtual reality augments the learning experience with immersive simulations
The orchestra augmented its sound with electronic instruments

definitions: predict or foretell future events especially from signs or omens
be a sign or warning of a future outcome or result
examples: Ancient priests would augur the future by observing bird flights
The fortune teller claimed to augur success in his ventures
Dark clouds augur an approaching storm this afternoon
These early polls augur well for the candidate's election chances

definitions: prove or confirm something is genuine or valid through verification
verify the identity of a user or system through security procedures
examples: Experts will authenticate the painting before the museum purchases it
The laboratory authenticates ancient artifacts using carbon dating methods
Users must authenticate their identity with passwords and biometric data
The system authenticates login attempts through two-factor verification

definitions: write a book article or other written work as its creator
be the originator or creator of something especially a plan or idea
examples: She authored three bestselling novels in five years
The professor authored numerous articles on climate change
The senator authored legislation to reform healthcare access
They authored a comprehensive plan for urban development

definitions: give official permission or approval for something to happen formally
give someone the power or right to do something legally
examples: The board authorised the new construction project yesterday afternoon
Parliament must authorise any increase in government spending
The manager authorised her assistant to sign contracts
The court authorised investigators to search the premises

definitions: give official permission or approval for something to happen formally
give someone the power or right to do something legally
examples: The committee authorized funding for the research project
Security must authorize all visitors before granting building access
The CEO authorized the department heads to hire new staff
Congress authorized the president to use military force

definitions: write one's signature on something especially for an admirer
sign one's name in one's own handwriting on documents
examples: The famous author autographed books for fans after the reading
The baseball player autographed jerseys at the charity event
Please autograph this contract where indicated with yellow markers
Artists often autograph limited edition prints to increase value

definitions: convert a process or facility to be operated by automatic equipment
make something operate automatically without human intervention using technology
examples: The factory automated its assembly line to increase production efficiency
Many companies automate repetitive tasks to reduce labor costs
Software can automate data entry and report generation processes
They plan to automate customer service using artificial intelligence

definitions: help or benefit someone in achieving something or improving a situation
use or take advantage of an opportunity or available resource
examples: All their efforts availed nothing against the powerful storm
His protests will not avail him in this legal matter
Students should avail themselves of free tutoring services offered
She availed herself of every opportunity to learn

definitions: fall or slide down a mountainside in a large mass rapidly
arrive or occur in overwhelming quantities or amounts suddenly
examples: Snow avalanched down the mountain burying everything in its path
Rocks avalanched onto the road during the earthquake
Complaints avalanched into the office after the service outage
Orders avalanched in after the viral social media post

definitions: inflict harm in return for an injury or wrong done to oneself
take vengeance on behalf of someone else for a wrong done
examples: He vowed to avenge his brother's death at any cost
The hero seeks to avenge the destruction of her village
They avenged themselves on their enemies through legal action
The team avenged last year's defeat with a decisive victory

definitions: calculate the arithmetic mean of a set of numbers or quantities
achieve or do something as a typical or usual amount
amount to or be equal to a particular number as a mean
examples: To find the score average all the test results together
Economists average monthly data to identify long-term trends
Professional players average twenty points per game this season
The factory averages five hundred units of production daily
Temperatures average around seventy degrees during spring months
Rainfall averages forty inches annually in this region

definitions: prevent something bad or dangerous from happening through action
turn away one's eyes or gaze from something unpleasant
examples: Quick diplomatic action averted a potential military conflict
Safety measures averted what could have been a terrible disaster
She averted her eyes from the gruesome accident scene
He averted his gaze when they brought up embarrassing topics
